titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the A. P. Watt & Son Records Relating to Rudyard Kipling
A. P. Watt & Son Records Relating to Rudyard Kipling
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:26

did.unittitle: A. P. Watt and Son records relating to Rudyard Kipling

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The records include writings, correspondence and printed materials by or relating to Rudyard Kipling. Writings consist of holograph manuscripts, corrected typescripts, and corrected proofs. The bulk of the correspondence consists of letters from Rudyard Kipling to A. P. Watt and Alec Watt written between 1889 and 1936 concerning both the publication of Kipling's writings and personal matters. Pamphlets by Kipling comprise the bulk of the printed material, which also includes clippings, ephemera and various other items.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bernard Quaritch, Ltd. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The A. P. Watt & Son Records Relating to Rudyard Kipling is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A. P. Watt & Son Records Relating top Rudyard Kipling. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: A. P. Watt & Son
bioghist.p: A. P. Watt and Son is a British literary agency founded in 1875 by A. P. (Alexander Pollock) Watt. Under A. P. Watt and later his son Alec Watt, the firm served as literary agents for Rudyard Kipling from 1889 until Kipling's death in 1936.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records include writings, correspondence and printed materials by or relating to Rudyard Kipling. Writings consist of holograph manuscripts, corrected typescripts, and corrected proofs. The bulk of the correspondence consists of letters from Rudyard Kipling to A. P. Watt and Alec Watt written between 1889 and 1936 concerning both the publication of Kipling's writings and personal matters. Pamphlets by Kipling comprise the bulk of the printed material, which also includes clippings, ephemera and various other items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: Series I. Writings, 1891-1920s. Series II. Correspondence, 1889-1938. Series III. Printed materials, 1891-1945.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Writings are arranged in loose alphabetical order.

did.unittitle: Kipling, Rudyard to A. P. Watt - Cannes, Burwash, Palace
Correspondence, clippings and lists relating to collecting and copyright

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed materials consist of works by Rudyard Kipling and others collected by A. P. Watt and Son.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Printed materials are organized into three groups: pamphlets, clippings and ephemera, and other printed materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Pamphlets are arranged in loose alphabetical order.
